intro: Paraphlomis albida f. shanghangensis, commonly known as the Shanghang white grass, is a rare and endemic plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, pale white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountainous regions with rich, loamy soil. It possesses medicinal properties and is valued for its potential use in traditional herbal remedies. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
